Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Synchronize \Syn"chro*nize\, v. i. [imp. & p. p. {Synchronized}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Synchronizing}.] [Gr. ?.] To agree in time; to be simultaneous. [1913 Webster]
The path of this great empire, through its arch of progress, synchronized with that of Christianity. --De Quincey. [1913 Webster]
synchronized adj : operating in unison; "the synchronized flapping of a bird's wings" [syn: {synchronised}]
